message_1: Given the following encrypted message using a Caesar cipher: "Lw zdv wkh frqvlvwhqw dqg zh fdq eh suhwwb rq wkh iluvw zd\dozrqlf ehbxv". Determine the original message by applying cryptanalysis techniques on substitution ciphers.
message_2:
To decrypt the Caesar cipher, we will try shifting the letters by different amounts and look for a meaningful message. Since there are 25 possible shifts (excluding the original message), we can try each one and see which one gives us a coherent message.

After trying different shifts, we find that shifting the letters by 3 positions back in the alphabet gives us the original message:

"It was the consistent and we can be pretty on the first always on the chaotic ways."

So, the decrypted message is: "It was the consistent and we can be pretty on the first always on the chaotic ways."
